name: 46694R301 - ITP - LEVEL 05 - Installation of RIS Anchor Points SA312, SA322, SA332, SA342, SA352, SA362
template name: 46694R301 - ITP - LEVEL 05 - Installation of RIS Anchor Points SA312, SA322, SA332, SA342, SA352, SA362

name: Roof profile minimum fixings and type
Position and orientation of anchor point to roof
Additional pendulum fixing points to roof to allow safe transition and access
Number of fixing and location of fixing to anchor point
CHARACTERISTICS - AS5532 7.1 a, b, c, d, e, f & g
REFERENCE - Systems can be accessed safely by trained persons without the risk of an uncontrolled fall
REFERENCE - Roof sheet is installed as per manufacturing instructions and guidelines
Minimum roof sheet width and length
REFERENCE - 3 x normal lapped roof sheets wide and crossing a minimum of three purlins or battens
REFERENCE - Purlin connected by M12 bolts each end of purlin, purlin details: C/Z15015 minimum size for attachment of anchor
Applications with roof raiser/Top hat section/rack systems for insulation integrity
REFERENCE - Custom made anchor with longer M12 thread to enable fixing to the purlin. The use of a RIS spacer is required to bridge the gap from the top of the purlin to the underside of the sheet.
COMMENTS - Nominate the type of structure utilized for this application:
Penetration of roof is not over sized
REFERENCE - Maximum 29mm hole sizes for top fixed anchors and 13mm hole used for anchors fixed with access underneath the roof.
Position and orientation of anchor point to roof
REFERENCE - Anchor sits flat and is at 90 degrees with the roof.  Eye bolt is orientated towards the intended access point.
Anchor points to roof to prevent lateral swing fall are installed or mitigation agreed
REFERENCE - The distance to the next anchor is less than the length to the closest edge, unless mitigated by other means.
Anchor at entry point with a stainless steel Strop
REFERENCE - Anchor strop must be positioned to enable user to reach and connect to.
○ Strop is marked and rated to 15kN.
○ Mallion/Quicklink connection to roof anchor point is secured and mechanically tightened or chemically set with loctite.
COMMENTS - Not applicable as anchor is not within the Fall Zone.
REFERENCE - Dissimilar metals are separated by EPDM barrier or sealant.
REFERENCE - Anchor sealed and inspected for water tight fit.
Site clean up and picture evidence if handover is not possible

REFERENCE - Site has been cleared of swarf or other debris installation inspection completed and witnessed by the customers representative.  Where a client cannot sign for handover, clear high resolution pictures have been taken of each anchor point.
REFERENCE - Anchor fit for use sticker/tag filled in and attached to the anchor point, mark with confirmed rating.  Entry point signage updated and installed.
Handover operating and systems documentation issued
I have carried out all necessary inspections and verify that the above items/activities conform to the contract specification/documents
